comment: She's a sweet heart and as hot as a microwave, but she's just not a very effective teacher. I would get a cup of coffee with her, but I wouldn't take her class again.

I enjoyed her class however, it was a little difficult.  Make sure you read and take good notes from EVERY chapter because the pop quizzes and tests come straight from there. I agree with others that she can be a little unclear on instructions for tasks as well as what is going to be on the tests.  Overall though I would recommend taking her class.
Overall, Dr. Davis was a good professor. Although her quizzes were challenging, she allowed for extra credit and was flexible in completing quizzes. Cool class activities

Davis is a sweet individual. Very upbeat and fun. She keeps me interested, not to mention she's a fox. Class is challenging and you do learn. Beware of her deadly almost-daily quizzes, though. They're rough. The tests are multiple choice and straight-forward.

Professor Davis was not a good teacher. Her expectations are extremely unclear. You have to basically teach yourself in this course. All she does is read straight from her slides. Her tests were extremely difficult. She gave very little direction on the paper and then graded it very harshly.

She is a nice teacher however she is very unclear on what she expects in her assignments. There was only one grade recieved before midpoint and 8 (2 test, 1 case analysis & 5 journals) due at the end of the semester. The subject matter is intresting however be prepared to teach yourself.

She is not really a good teacher. She knows a lot about disorders and the abnormal world, but she doesn't teach it well. She reads off powerpoints, and expectations are unclear. Tests are difficult, especially since you never know what's going to be on them!
